_description: Chronological log of system events in AI-OS

details: Created missing State Layer files: SESSION_NOTE.md, INFRA_MAP.md, AGENT_SYNC_OVERVIEW.md, AGENT_CAPABILITY_PROFILE.md, SERVICES_STATUS.json, EVENT_TIMELINE.jsonl

summary: Simplified agent role model â€“ removed rigid role hierarchy between GPT/Claude/Or, moved to single AI-OS model with multiple interfaces

details.notes: Removed Primary executor/Planner roles, Trust Levels, and Agent Responsibilities Matrix. Replaced with flexible interface model. Or is now owner/approver, not zero tech actions rule. Kept all safety rules (no remote push without approval, INFRA_ONLY constraints).

summary: Created SYSTEM_STATE_COMPACT.json - single JSON source for external agents

details.purpose: Provide compact, structured JSON representation of AI-OS state for external agents, Deep Research, and analysis tools
details.content: 3 interfaces (Claude, GPT, Chat1), 11 services, 8 open gaps, safety constraints, state layer references
details.notes: Reflects simplified role model from ROLE_MODEL_SIMPLIFICATION_V1. No rigid hierarchy, unified AI-OS architecture.

summary: Merged remote Phase 2.2-2.3 changes with local State Layer V1 work

details.strategy: Accepted remote versions for conflicted files (Phase 2.2-2.3 updates), kept all local State Layer files
details.remote_changes: Phase 2.2 Claude Healthcheck, Phase 2.3 Stabilizing The Hands, new docs: CLAUDE_HEALTHCHECK_SPEC.md, PHASE2_SUMMARY.md, active_plans/, scripts/, services/
details.local_changes: State Layer V1 complete (SYSTEM_STATE_COMPACT.json, AGENT_CAPABILITY_PROFILE.md, etc.), Role Model Simplification

details.notes: This set of files and blocks is considered the baseline State Layer (V1) for Phase 2.2-2.3. All future infra and automation work must keep these files consistent and up to date.

action: Updated SERVICES_STATUS & AUTOMATIONS_REGISTRY and created TOOL_INTEGRATION_MAP_V1

automations_added: AUTO-GAS-001: Collector_Gmail_to_Records (legacy Apps Script, status: error_auth)
notes: Documented real-world access patterns for GitHub and Google Workspace
Added access_patterns fields to clarify Claude (read-only) vs GPT (full R/W) for Google services
Registered legacy Apps Script that's currently failing with auth error
Created comprehensive integration map showing who can access what and how

summary: Created playbook for manual Sync Agent sessions using OODA loop on State Layer Blackboard

details.purpose: Provide lightweight, practical template for running manual Sync Agent sessions between Or, Claude Desktop, and GPT Operator
content: When to run a Sync Session (triggers, examples)
Session Inputs: SYSTEM_STATE_COMPACT.json, AGENT_SYNC_OVERVIEW.md, TOOL_INTEGRATION_MAP.md, EVENT_TIMELINE.jsonl
OODA Loop: Observe (what changed), Orient (gaps/inconsistencies/opportunities), Decide (propose Blocks), Act (execute with approval)
Output sections: findings_since_last_session, detected_gaps, proposed_blocks, tool_risks_and_open_questions
Usage tips for Claude, GPT, and Or
constraints: INFRA_ONLY - no automations on Or's life
No n8n workflows, no Apps Script changes
notes: Uses existing State Layer without schema changes
Ready for immediate use in daily/weekly sync sessions
